name: fooling
content:
Add to word list

present participle of
fool
B2 [ I or T ] to trick someone: Don't be fooled by his appearance. She said she was doing it to help me, but I wasn't fooled. Tim was fooled into believing that he'd won a lot of money.

you could have fooled me! informal
used to tell someone that you do not believe what they have just said: "Really, I'm very happy." "You could have fooled me."
